Articles.Content:
every time i try to run ksp, it just crashes after it loads everything. it is getting really frustrating:mad:.

I'm running 0.25.0 with no mods what so ever.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/hykl80ramlbv9wo/output_log.txt?dl=0

KSP v0.25 eats up more memory. If you only have 4GB of system memory, KSP crashes at the main menu because it spikes out on memory usage.

1. Open up your settings.cfg file.

2. Look for the line that says "TEXTURE_QUALITY = "

3. Make it say "TEXTURE_QUALITY = 1" (or you can also try 2, or even 3)

4. Restart KSP, and set your Texture Quality to no higher than half (in the settings page on the main menu).

Cheers,

~Claw
it works now, thank you very much!

That particular log isn't as handy as the outpot_log.txt file. However, it indicates that you only have 1GB of physical ram. Something appears very wrong with your setup if you say that you have 16GB. Is KSP also running horribly slow for you?

-Claw

That particular log isn't as handy as the outpot_log.txt file. However, it indicates that you only have 1GB of physical ram. Something appears very wrong with your setup if you say that you have 16GB. Is KSP also running horribly slow for you?

-Claw

the game is only slow when the craft becomes 1000 part + big

here is the output log

https://www./?30a5nc8dd177e4n

Do i have to re-install the game???

Edited October 25, 2014 by soulreaver1981

That's the error.log, not the output log. See the Stock Support & Bug Reporting Guide for where to find your output log.

The error.log also says you have only 1 GB of RAM. Could you post a screenshot of Task Manager on the Processes tab?

i thought that i had the output log this is it i think

http://www./view/s170x4mnjb25ci8/output_log.txt

Hmm... That crashes with an unhelpful error:

========== OUTPUTING STACK TRACE ==================

(0x01A896C0) (KSP): (filename not available): NxCreateCoreSDK + 0x740

(0x01AB9FEC) (KSP): (filename not available): NxCreateCoreSDK + 0x3106c

========== END OF STACKTRACE ===========

That suggests an odd out-of-memory situation, though I can't explain why KSP is only seeing 1 GB of RAM, unless it's counting video RAM and system RAM together as the accessible 4 GB. This log reports 3 GB of video RAM. Is that right? If not, is there a setting the NVidia drivers that lets you change how much system RAM is allocated to the video card?

Not likely to be helpful, but you could try reinstalling and/or copying KSP somewhere else. Just remember to back up your saves first.

Not likely to be helpful, but you could try reinstalling and/or copying KSP somewhere else. Just remember to back up your saves first.
